intro: Cryptantha hansenii var. pulchella, commonly known as the Hansen's cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has a low, mat-forming growth habit with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
